intro: Peucedanum anatolicum, commonly known as Anatolian cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to Turkey and parts of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are oval and ridged, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
